channel.title: Redstone
channel.description:
well so far ive been able to get a circuit working like i wanted. my question though is why when i move my pressure pad does it change the out come? is there a delay causing a problem? if so would i have to do is add a delay on the part of the circuit that is faster than the other. my idea was making a circuit is a switch that keeps its state. idk if there is an easier way to do it than i did. but i took a IC class in high school so the gates arent anything new. but im wanting to do way more complex projects. what i would like to see though in Minecraft is magnets and electric magnets, i think you could do a lot of cool things. essentially you could build a speaker like that worked if the game physics allowed it.
my circuit uses 2 and, 2 nor, 2 not, 1 rs nor latch, 1 delay, and a couple of repeaters.

item.title: Redstone
item.dc:creator: @noobs_are_ftw noobs are ftw
item.description:
@noobs_are_ftw wrote:

[quote=“merk n a box, post:4, topic:387005”]The Redstone repeater’s also act as a delay depending on there setting.
i think its 1-3-5 second delay[/quote]

i had a few lined up set at full for a 2 second delay for me door(i removed from lagg lol redstone really laggs a person)

Read full topic

item.title: Redstone
item.dc:creator: @LilXCj LilXCj
item.description:
@LilXCj wrote:

Changing position of your pressure plate is possibly effected by the RS NOR Latch or the delay.

If your input is farther away, it will take longer to get the the output and vice versa.

Read full topic

well so far ive been able to get a circuit working like i wanted. my question though is why when i move my pressure pad does it change the out come? is there a delay causing a problem? if so would i have to do is add a delay on the part of the circuit that is faster than the other. my idea was making a circuit is a switch that keeps its state. idk if there is an easier way to do it than i did. but i took a IC class in high school so the gates arent anything new. but im wanting to do way more complex projects. what i would like to see though in Minecraft is magnets and electric magnets, i think you could do a lot of cool things. essentially you could build a speaker like that worked if the game physics allowed it.
